Description: Discus fragment from a mould-made lamp, cut down into a roundel and the edges smoothed: coin of Janus, from a New Year lamp. Incised mark into the rear.Probably cut down in antiquity for a gaming-counter, but perhaps produced by a modern dealer and the number added by him. Buff clay; brown slip. Probably an Italian fabric.
Curator's comments: Compare N. Benseddik and T. W. Potter, 'Fouilles du forum de Cherchel 1977-1981', Algiers, 1992, fig. 70, 19.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (957 ter)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Rev W F Rose
